title: Welcome!
text:
Twitter
  
  
    
     Github
  

  
  

Welcome!
Quantlab is a new network group aiming to bring together social scientists at the University of Melbourne and beyond to share insights in quantitative methods and research.
Co-founders: Seraphine F. Maerz Seraphine F. Maerz (Political Science) and Irma Mooi-Reci Irma Mooi-Reci (Sociology).
We are an inclusive network and welcome everyone interested in learning (more) about new quantitative methods and computational techniques. We believe in knowledge sharing and offer learning seminars as well as online tutorials about innovations in data management and analysis, and a platform for code sharing (R, Stata, Python, R Markdown, LaTeX, Quarto).
Come join us for our bi-weekly Quantlunches, RSVP here!





Schedule for 2024
We meet in Arts West Research Lounge. Lunch is kindly sponsored by the School of Social and Political Science.



Date/Time
Topic
Presenter




05/08/24, 11:30-13:00 (free lunch included)
Launch of QuantLab, Intro to R and R Markdown for more efficient workflows
Seraphine F. Maerz, Irma Mooi-Reci


26/08/24, 12:00-13:00 (free lunch included)
Using Stata for advanced analyses of panel data
Irma Mooi-Reci


09/09/24, 12:00-13:00 (free lunch included)
Online experiments and quasi-experimental designs
Aaron Martin, Ed Goldring (tbc)


tbc
Simulation models (co-presentation as part of the Social Science weeks)

14/10/24, 12:00-13:00 (free lunch included)
The basics of quantitative text analysis in R
Seraphine F. Maerz


28/10/24, 12:00-13:00 (free lunch included)
Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) in Stata
Harry Ganzeboom
